pullRequest.body:
* Rename some theorems to remove primed variants
* Move `simp` attribute from `IsSquare.sq` to `Even.isSquare_pow` for consistency
* Remove unhelpful alias
* Golf some proofs
* Make notation consistent throughout proofs

Moves:
`Even.nsmul` -> `Even.nsmul_right`
`Even.nsmul'` -> `Even.nsmul_left`
`Even.zsmul` -> `Even.zsmul_right`
`Even.zsmul'` -> `Even.zsmul_left`
`isSquare_zero` -> `IsSquare.zero`

Deletions:
`isSquare_of_exists_sq` (prefer `IsSquare.sq`)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [b5a3e9dde1](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20558/commits/b5a3e9dde1085a7ec04152f99e5618ae7f625b2a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Even.nsmul`
`+ Even.nsmul'`
`+ Even.zsmul`
`+ Even.zsmul'`
`+ IsSquare.zero`
`+ even_zero`
`+ ‚ü®_,`
`- IsSquare.inv`
`- isSquare_of_exists_sq`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

To clarify, no `aesop` attributes are changed here -- only added. One `simp` lemma is removed due to having an inappropriate form. Would you like me to move my additions of `aesop` attributes to a separate PR?

I'm not sure it's right to call this chore
I did add some new (easy) lemmas
If none of `feat`, `refactor`, `chore` fits for all of a PR, then that probably means it should be split up into its `feat`, `refactor`, `chore` parts.

> If none of `feat`, `refactor`, `chore` fits for all of a PR, then that probably means it should be split up into its `feat`, `refactor`, `chore` parts.

#20818
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
This PR is marked "awaiting author". Should the label be removed?

:v: artie2000 can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> This PR is marked "awaiting author". Should the label be removed?

Ah, I had missed that!

bors d-
@adomani I'm confused about the status of this PR. Should I go ahead with the merge?
I think the confusion is simply that you forgot to remove `awaiting-author`. I would say you can merge, yes.
Oh sorry! I'll merge once it passes CI
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12928446460/job/36055730447)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12928446460/job/36055730181)

Thanks, this looks good!

Please, update the comment, if you want, add a sentence to the doc-string and then merge!

bors d+

Thanks! üöÄ

maintainer merge
Sorry to be this person once again, but tweaking aesop priorities is so experimental that I would rather it be a standalone PR. Can you make it a separate PR depending on this one?

Thanks! üöÄ

maintainer merge

Thanks, this looks good!

Please, update the comment, if you want, add a sentence to the doc-string and then merge!

bors d+
Could you write a library note explaining the priority you choose here?
I'll do this in general in #20477 and then review the priorities in this PR.

```suggestion
@[to_additive] alias ‚ü®_, IsSquare.inv‚ü© := isSquare_inv
```
should work
Not sure why you're renaming this one. Current name seems correct (and better)

current one has a dash, and has inconsistent additive and multiplicative names
(see also the change to Even.isSquare_pow)

Ah sorry, I'd already commented here

It makes sense that the additive and multiplicative names are different, since the `IsSquare` becomes `Even` and suddenly matches the namespace.

If you want to remove the dash, consider renaming `Even.zsmul`/`Even.zsmul'` to `Even.zsmul_right`/`Even.zsmul_left`
done

```suggestion
  constructor <;> intro h <;> simpa using (isSquare_op_iff.mpr h).map (MulEquiv.inv' Œ±).symm
```

I still don't understand that change.
* The previous additive name was more appropriate
* Why are you removing `simp`?

simp will basically never match because it has a nontrivial hypothesis, right?
originally I was replacing simp with aesop, but the second part's been delayed to #20781

> simp will basically never match because it has a nontrivial hypothesis, right?

What do you mean? simp can handle conditional lemmas

> originally I was replacing simp with aesop, but the second part's been delayed to #20781

Then you should delay removing the simp attribute until #20781

> > simp will basically never match because it has a nontrivial hypothesis, right?
> 
> What do you mean? simp can handle conditional lemmas

oh it can? is there somewhere I can read about this?
in this specific case we should also add the simp tag to the nsmul version, then

> is there somewhere I can read about this?

Hopefully in the simp documentation but I can't check currently

> in this specific case we should also add the simp tag to the nsmul version, then

üëç

ah OK
it discharges side conditions up to a depth of 2
good to know

```suggestion
lemma isSquare_iff_exists_sq (a : Œ±) : IsSquare a ‚Üî ‚àÉ r, a = r ^ 2 := by simp [IsSquare, pow_two]
```

This might help untangle the diff
```suggestion
@[deprecated (since := "2024-12-27")] alias IsSquare_sq := IsSquare.sq
@[deprecated (since := "2024-12-27")] alias even_two_nsmul := Even.two_nsmul
```

Did you mean
```suggestion
  fun ‚ü®r, _‚ü© ‚ü®s, _‚ü© => ‚ü®r * s, by simp [*, mul_mul_mul_comm]‚ü©
```

I think this was extracted from aesop originally
Your suggestion is probably better
The lack of symmetry between `IsSquare` and `Even` make me a bit uncomfortable here; @YaelDillies, do you prefer the new names?
I think they are okay, yes. See https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20558#discussion_r1921494679
I think this change makes `isSquare_mul_self` no longer deprecated. Please leave as is
What's the purpose of this change? If you want to impose some kind of consistent argument naming convention, it should be documented in the module docstring.
I changed the argument names throughout the file to be consistent in order to make the file more readable. Can you give an example of such notation documentation?

It looks like the undocumented convention is that `r` is a "square `r`oot" of `a`, where possible.

I don't think that it is too important to enforce this, but you can, if you want, add a sentence to the doc-string.

Yeah I didn't want to go and write a specification, but I thought I might as well make the variables consistent throughout the file, just to make it easier to read through
At the moment the file is quite messy
Ditto
Not sure this is necessarily better
suggested by @YaelDillies; what do you think Yael?
I didn't suggest removing `rintro`, only replacing `simp_all` by `simp [*]`

Oh mb
in any case this proof comes from undoing my Aesop automation. I don't really mind what the proofs are given that I want to replace everything with Aesop eventually anyway, but the differences in speed seem pretty marginal to me
Just so I can change all the proofs in this file to the right style rather than 1-by-1 (and for future reference), why is the original proof here better?

I would say it's because it uses `rfl` to substitute rather than relying on `simp [*]` (which only does the same as `rfl` if the hypothesis is `free_variable = big_expression` and not `big_expression = free_variable`). But it's quite marginal.
Here too

```suggestion
  have hn : n ‚â† 0 := by rintro rfl; exact Int.not_even_iff_odd.2 h .zero
```

```suggestion
  | 0 => .zero
```

```suggestion
  exact Int.not_even_iff_odd.2 hn .zero
```

```suggestion
    ¬∑ exact (h2 .zero).elim
```

```suggestion
-- provable by simp in `Algebra.Ring.Parity`
```
